newsitem.title: USA: Solucorp Industries Ltd finalizes pact.
newsitem.headline: Solucorp Industries Ltd finalizes pact.

text.p: Solucorp Industries Ltd said Friday that it has finalized the renewal of its U.K. exclusive licensing agreement for the company's proprietary Molecular Bonding System with John Beech Ltd for $600,000.
The agreement also includes annual royalties and tonnage processing requirements, the company said.
In February, Solucorp said it and Beech had reached an agreement in principle for a second license of MBS technology to cover all of Europe, in addition to the U.K.
This agreement, signed in April, has a potential value to Solucorp of $64.5 million, it said.

Solucorp President Peter Mantia said in a statement that "the company has now received a good faith, non-refundable payment of $200,000 from Beech towards the European agreement, and both Solucorp and Beech are continuing efforts towards finalizing this complex license for Europe."
John Beech Ltd, an environmental remediation contractor, is based in Merseyside, U.K.
Solucorp develops products for environmental markets, focusing particularly on solving the problem of heavy metals contamination.
